meanings.definition: To coat or impregnate with metal.
meanings.sent1: The artist decided to metallize the sculpture for a shiny finish.
meanings.sent2: The factory uses a special machine to metallize the plastic parts.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally metallized my sandwich with aluminum foil instead of plastic wrap!
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to metallize the room, brightening everyone's mood.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays seemed to metallize the ocean, turning it into a sheet of liquid silver.

meanings.sent1: The alchemist claimed he could metallize any substance into gold.
meanings.sent2: The intense heat can metallize the ore into pure iron.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could metallize my homework into good grades with a magic spell!
meanings.sent4: Her determination seemed to metallize her dreams into reality.
meanings.sent5: The music seemed to metallize the air, filling it with a golden glow.
